channel.title: Great Games to Play
channel.description:
So I was searching for some great games to for me to get, so I looked around the internet, and decided to come up with this list, which acts as a checklist of sorts for me, as well as a recommendation list for others if they are interested. So the main point of this thread is if any of you have recommendations of some great games, or just feedback in general, such as your opinions on the ones on the list, any essential mods, etc. post them here. I might update it with any new ones I forgot.
I got quite a few of these from antisocialfatman (for those who haven't heard of him, he's a very good reviewer, he died earlier this month, but you should check him out nonetheless.) [url]https://www.youtube.com/user/antisocialfatman#g/p[/url]
My games to eventually play-
System Shock 2 Fallout 1 Fallout 2 Escape from Butcher Bay - Dark Athena? Deus Ex Vampire the Masquerade Bloodlines World of Goo Sins of a Solar Empire Company of Heroes Mirrors Edge The Misadventures of PB Winterbottom Baldurs Gate 1 Baldurs Gate 2 Planetscape Torment Neverwinter Nights 1 Neverwinter Nights 2 Knights of the Old Republic 1 Knights of the Old Republic 2- maybe F.E.A.R. Goldeneye 07 Skyrim Deus Ex Human Revolution Batman Arkham City

Vitriol:

HomeWorld series
Lode Runner (honourable arcade game mention)

Fuck yes.

I had the PC and PS versions of lode runner, they both had level editors. Shit was awesome.

item.title: Great Games to Play
item.dc:creator: Bloodshot
item.description:
Add Arena to my list. It’s never held my attention for that long but i could see why some people love it.

Oh and seriously, Hexen and Hexen 2 are the PERFECT games for coop - Hexen 2 even has a built in save multiplayer-game feature.

Read full topic

Add nearly every single Zelda game to the list, mainly OOT, ALTTP, and Twilight Princess.

Yes.

Read full topic

item.title: Great Games to Play
item.dc:creator: Bloodshot
item.description:
(rot)(fodder:

It makes me laugh that there is no apb (I’m not suggesting you add it btw)

It outrages me to see that no one has mentioned Unreal and Unreal Tournament(99).

:hmph:

Bloodshot:

Quake
Doom
Daggerfall
Battlefield 1942/2/3
Unreal 1
Hexen/Hexen 2
Half-life
Terminator Future Shock
Descent/Descent 2
Dark Forces 1/Jedi Knight/Jedi Knight 2
Heretic 1/2
Call of Duty 1/2
FF7 with hardcore difficulty mod and graphics mods (PC version)
Blood
Duke Nukem 3D

In no particular order.

Seriously, PLAY ALL OF THOSE

I didn’t mention UT99 cuz that’s a given once you find out about unreal in any form.

Also, i remember Nox. Very little, some caves with lava - also i remember i was impressed how when you walked through a door the shadows would come from it as if you were the light source, and I remember seeing a guy get sucked into a TV, and a hot air balloon. That’s about it.

Read full topic

item.title: Great Games to Play
item.dc:creator: Midnightcoast
item.description:
I see that a lot of my favorite games have already been mention. Here’s a few that haven’t been mentioned yet. Clive Barker’s Undying, the ending sucks but the build-up to it is good. Nox, a Diablo clone with a quirky sense of humor. Torchlight is OK too although it seemed kind of short.

Read full topic

item.title: Great Games to Play
item.dc:creator: _rot_fodder
item.description:
It makes me laugh that there is no apb (I’m not suggesting you add it btw)

It outrages me to see that no one has mentioned Unreal and Unreal Tournament(99).

I also really liked UT2004, come at me bros. It needs some mods, nothing in particular though, just stuff to make it interesting. One really good one for it is Ballistic weapons.

UT3 was fun too, but there was only one good map in the whole game, VCTF-Suspense.

EDIT: The Riddick games are great, and highly recommended. I did a quest in Skyrim that was pretty Butcher Bay, and I was all :awesome:.

Read full topic

item.description:
Get Dark Athena. It comes with everything in the original game, developer commentary and all, plus Dark Athena. I got it full price and it was worth it.

item.title: Great Games to Play
item.dc:creator: arizzi
item.description:
CTID:

How is that even a question? I’m sorry, but it’s retarded to ask “Should I look for a rare, outdated copy of a game, or buy the sequel to it that also includes the first game with better character models and lighting effects, along with the second game?”

Its more of a pricing thing, I don’t particularly care for graphics, and assault on dark athena costs around $20-30 more where I live, and I can’t get it on amazon or ebay from my location.

Read full topic

item.title: Great Games to Play
item.dc:creator: CTID
item.description:
arizzi:

I have some questions, do you guys recommend Assault on Dark Athena, or should I just get Escape from Butcher Bay. I know that they upgraded Butcher Bay with better lighting and crap, but how does Dark Athena stack up to the original?

How is that even a question? I’m sorry, but it’s retarded to ask “Should I look for a rare, outdated copy of a game, or buy the sequel to it that also includes the first game with better character models and lighting effects, along with the second game?”

Read full topic

item.title: Great Games to Play
item.dc:creator: arizzi
item.description:
I have some questions, do you guys recommend Assault on Dark Athena, or should I just get Escape from Butcher Bay. I know that they upgraded Butcher Bay with better lighting and crap, but how does Dark Athena stack up to the original?

Is there any game on that list that is bad and shouldn’t be included, because I intend to go on a “best of the best” videogame spree at some point.

Also Please don’t try just to list whatever game comes to your head, or your favorite game, list the games that you believe can be considered “great” of course its always going to be an opinion, but do give it some thought.

Read full topic

item.title: Great Games to Play
item.dc:creator: Fuskox
item.description:
I’ve played since year one, on and off of course, but I used to do endgame raiding heavily, I PvP’d seriously, and I would just fuck around with my friends and do exploits and glitches all the time. It’s a great, fun game, but I am starting to get burned out, 7 years is a bit much for me, and Cata and Wotlk have been lackluster compared to TBC imo, but it’s still a great game.

Read full topic

item.title: Great Games to Play
item.dc:creator: CTID
item.description:
WoW is legitmately fun in moderation to me. I can’t play it for hours/days on end like some people can without brushing with death out of boredom, but it’s not a bad game. And it’s an unbelievably well-designed game, it wouldn’t still be around after 7 years and completely destroy all of its competition if it wasn’t. People who say WoW is shit are people who have never tried it, typically, or just don’t like MMOs, because out of all of the MMOs I’ve played, WoW is the only good one, imo.

Read full topic

item.title: Great Games to Play

item.description:
^^ All the DoW games, and Space Marine is quite fun.

Sorry if I list things you already have.

Starcraft 1, Brood War, and Starcraft 2
Amnesia: The Dark Descent
The Witcher, The Witcher 2

Battlefield 2, Bad Company 2, Battlefield 3
GTA 3: Vice City, San Andreas, and GTA IV
Just Cause 2
Counter Strike, Counter Strike Source
Team Fortress 2
Fallout 3
Warcraft 3
World of Warcraft
Crysis
Uncharted trilogy
Need For Speed: Hot Pursuit
Dirt 3
Call of Duty 2, Call of Duty 4
Terraria, Minecraft

So many other games to think of, maybe I’ll post more soon.
